intro: Lucilia pedunculata, commonly known as the common green alga, is a species of green algae belonging to the family Chlorophyceae. It is characterized by its simple, filamentous structure composed of unbranched or slightly branched cells. This aquatic plant thrives in freshwater environments, often found in ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. Lucilia pedunculata plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by serving as a primary producer and a food source for various microorganisms and small aquatic animals. Its rapid growth and ability to reproduce asexually contribute to its widespread distribution in temperate regions.
